ccnseqwriter.c

00001 /**
00002  * @file ccnseqwriter.c
00003  * Streams data from stdin into ccn
00004  *
00005  * A CCNx command-line utility.
00006  *
00007  * Copyright (C) 2010-2012 Palo Alto Research Center, Inc.

00020 #include <errno.h>
00021 #include <stdio.h>
00022 #include <stdlib.h>
00023 #include <string.h>
00024 #include <unistd.h>
00025 #include <ccn/ccn.h>
00026 #include <ccn/uri.h>
00027 #include <ccn/seqwriter.h>
00028 
00029 static void
00030 usage(const char *progname)
00031 {
00032         fprintf(stderr,
00033                 "%s [-h] [-b 0<blocksize<=4096] [-r] ccnx:/some/uri\n"
00034                 "    Reads stdin, sending data under the given URI"
00035                 " using ccn versioning and segmentation.\n"
00036                 "    -h generate this help message.\n"
00037                 "    -b specify the block (segment) size for content objects.  Default 1024.\n"
00038                 "    -r generate start-write interest so a repository will"
00039                 " store the content.\n"
00040                 "    -s n set scope of start-write interest.\n"
00041                 "       n = 1(local), 2(neighborhood), 3(everywhere) Default 1.\n"
00042                 "    -x specify the freshness for content objects.\n",
00043                 progname);
00044         exit(1);
00045 }
00046 /*
00047  * make_template: construct an interest template containing the specified scope
00048  *     An unlimited scope is passed in as 3, and the omission of the scope
00049  *     field from the template indicates this.
00050  */
00051 struct ccn_charbuf *
00052 make_template(int scope)
00053 {
00054     struct ccn_charbuf *templ = NULL;
00055     templ = ccn_charbuf_create();
00056     ccn_charbuf_append_tt(templ, CCN_DTAG_Interest, CCN_DTAG);
00057     ccn_charbuf_append_tt(templ, CCN_DTAG_Name, CCN_DTAG);
00058     ccn_charbuf_append_closer(templ); /* </Name> */
00059     if (0 <= scope && scope <= 2)
00060         ccnb_tagged_putf(templ, CCN_DTAG_Scope, "%d", scope);
00061     ccn_charbuf_append_closer(templ); /* </Interest> */
00062     return(templ);
00063 }
00064 
00065 int
00066 main(int argc, char **argv)
00067 {
00068     const char *progname = argv[0];
00069     struct ccn *ccn = NULL;
00070     struct ccn_charbuf *name = NULL;
00071     struct ccn_seqwriter *w = NULL;
00072     int blocksize = 1024;
00073     int freshness = -1;
00074     int torepo = 0;
00075     int scope = 1;
00076     int i;
00077     int status = 0;
00078     int res;
00079     ssize_t read_res;
00080     size_t blockread;
00081     unsigned char *buf = NULL;
00082     struct ccn_charbuf *templ;
00083     
00084     while ((res = getopt(argc, argv, "hrb:s:x:")) != -1) {
00085         switch (res) {
00086             case 'b':
00087                 blocksize = atoi(optarg);
00088                 if (blocksize <= 0 || blocksize > 4096)
00089                     usage(progname);
00090                 break;
00091             case 'r':
00092                 torepo = 1;
00093                 break;
00094             case 's':
00095                 scope = atoi(optarg);
00096                 if (scope < 1 || scope > 3)
00097                     usage(progname);
00098                 break;
00099             case 'x':
00100                 freshness = atoi(optarg);
00101                 if (freshness < 0)
00102                     usage(progname);
00103                 break;
00104             default:
00105             case 'h':
00106                 usage(progname);
00107                 break;
00108         }
00109     }
00110     argc -= optind;
00111     argv += optind;
00112     if (argc != 1)
00113         usage(progname);
00114     name = ccn_charbuf_create();
00115     res = ccn_name_from_uri(name, argv[0]);
00116     if (res < 0) {
00117         fprintf(stderr, "%s: bad CCN URI: %s\n", progname, argv[0]);
00118         exit(1);
00119     }
00120     ccn = ccn_create();
00121     if (ccn_connect(ccn, NULL) == -1) {
00122         perror("Could not connect to ccnd");
00123         exit(1);
00124     }
00125     
00126     buf = calloc(1, blocksize);
00127     
00128     w = ccn_seqw_create(ccn, name);
00129     if (w == NULL) {
00130         fprintf(stderr, "ccn_seqw_create failed\n");
00131         exit(1);
00132     }
00133     ccn_seqw_set_block_limits(w, blocksize, blocksize);
00134     if (freshness > -1)
00135         ccn_seqw_set_freshness(w, freshness);
00136     if (torepo) {
00137         struct ccn_charbuf *name_v = ccn_charbuf_create();
00138         ccn_seqw_get_name(w, name_v);
00139         ccn_name_from_uri(name_v, "%C1.R.sw");
00140         ccn_name_append_nonce(name_v);
00141         templ = make_template(scope);
00142         res = ccn_get(ccn, name_v, templ, 60000, NULL, NULL, NULL, 0);
00143         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&templ);
00144         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&name_v);
00145         if (res < 0) {
00146             fprintf(stderr, "No response from repository\n");
00147             exit(1);
00148         }
00149     }
00150     blockread = 0;
00151     for (i = 0;; i++) {
00152         while (blockread < blocksize) {
00153             ccn_run(ccn, 1);
00154             read_res = read(0, buf + blockread, blocksize - blockread);
00155             if (read_res == 0)
00156                 goto cleanup;
00157             if (read_res < 0) {
00158                 perror("read");
00159                 status = 1;
00160                 goto cleanup;
00161             }
00162             blockread += read_res;
00163         }
00164         res = ccn_seqw_write(w, buf, blockread);
00165         while (res == -1) {
00166             ccn_run(ccn, 100);
00167             res = ccn_seqw_write(w, buf, blockread);
00168         }
00169         if (res != blockread)
00170             abort(); /* hmm, ccn_seqw_write did a short write or something */
00171         blockread = 0;
00172     }
00173     
00174 cleanup:
00175     // flush out any remaining data and close
00176     if (blockread > 0) {
00177         res = ccn_seqw_write(w, buf, blockread);
00178         while (res == -1) {
00179             ccn_run(ccn, 100);
00180             res = ccn_seqw_write(w, buf, blockread);
00181         }
00182     }
00183     ccn_seqw_close(w);
00184     ccn_run(ccn, 1);
00185     free(buf);
00186     buf = NULL;
00187     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&name);
00188     ccn_destroy(&ccn);
00189     exit(status);
00190 }
